message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.CR 

The paper focuses on analysing the behaviour of Russian trolls on Twitter, which involves natural language processing (NLP) and social network analysis (SNA). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), which covers research on social networks, online communities, and information diffusion. The paper also uses NLP techniques to develop a novel text distance metric, which suggests that it could be classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper discusses the manipulation of public opinion and political divides, which falls under the scope of cs.SOC (Computational Social Science). The paper also touches upon cybersecurity issues, such as online trolling and propaganda, which could be classified under cs.CYBER (Cybersecurity) or cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
